byline.original: By MICHAEL WILSON and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

abstract: False report of gunfire and resulting panic at Kennedy International Airport has offered experts opportunity to study security at the Queens airport; police have not confirmed different theories as to how panic, which did not result in any injuries or deaths, started, but review of video footage suggests it began with false alarm near cafe in Terminal 8.

headline.print_headline: False Reports of Gunfire Create a Real Case Study in Airport Security
headline.main: False Reports of Gunfire at J.F.K. Airport Offer a Real Case Study in Security

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: With no loss of life or serious injuries, the bizarre episode is being seen as something of a gift, giving officials a case study in airport security and the gaps within....
lead_paragraph: With no loss of life or serious injuries, the bizarre episode is being seen as something of a gift, giving officials a case study in airport security and the gaps within.
